contents.author: － Lucius Annaeus Seneca
contents.lecture: "One of the most beautiful qualities of true friendship is to understand and to be understood"

contents.author: – Oscar Wilde
contents.lecture: "Keep love in your heart. A life without it is like a sunless garden when the flowers are dead"

contents.author: – Soren Kierkegaard
contents.lecture: "Life is not a problem to be solved, but a reality to be experienced"

contents.author: – Joseph Addison
contents.lecture: "Reading is to the mind what exercise is to the body"

contents.author: –  Abraham Lincoln
contents.lecture: "In the end, it’s not the years in your life that count. It’s the life in your years"

contents.author: – William Arthur Ward
contents.lecture: "The pessimist complains about the wind; the optimist expects it to change; the realist adjusts the sails"

contents.author: – Harvey Mackay
contents.lecture: "People begin to become successful the minute they decide to be"

contents.author: – Loretta Young
contents.lecture: "I believe in living today. Not in yesterday, nor in tomorrow"

contents.author: – Luciano Pavarotti
contents.lecture: "The rivalry is with ourself. I try to be better than is possible. I fight against myself, not against the other"

contents.author: – James Allen
contents.lecture: "The outer conditions of a person’s life will always be found to reflect their inner beliefs"
